question_bank.diffident: TESTEven when he knew the answer, he hesitated and spoke as if he doubted himself. His teacher described him as _____.
question_bank.prophetic: Her warning about the company’s fragile finances sounded exaggerated at first. Two years later, it seemed _____ when the firm collapsed exactly as she predicted.
question_bank.distribution: The report includes a histogram, not just an average value. It shows the full age _____ of the participants.
question_bank.authoritative: The committee relied on a peer-reviewed clinical guideline rather than rumors online. They wanted a/an _____ source before changing the protocol.
question_bank.collaborating: Two research groups are sharing data and writing one manuscript together. They are _____ on a multicenter study with a single protocol.
question_bank.debilitate: Weeks of untreated infection left him too weak to walk up stairs. The illness continued to _____ him until he received proper treatment.
question_bank.contentious: The proposal split the board into hostile factions. The meeting became so _____ that the chair had to call a recess.
question_bank.reticent: When asked about the lawsuit, she gave only short, guarded replies. Her lawyer advised her to remain _____.
question_bank.authoritarian: The regime censored newspapers and punished dissent. Under such a/an _____ government, criticism can be dangerous.
question_bank.prudence: She refused to invest without reading every clause in the prospectus. Basic _____ guided her decision to avoid unnecessary risk.
question_bank.munificent: The donor made an extraordinarily large cash donation that funded scholarships for a decade. The university called the gift _____.
question_bank.mitigate: The lab installed backup power to reduce the impact of outages. These safeguards helped _____ the risk of data loss.
question_bank.duplicitous: He praised the team in public but secretly undermined them in private emails. His coworkers realized he was _____.
question_bank.conducive: The library’s quiet rules and good lighting help students focus. The environment is _____ to studying.
question_bank.notorious: The nightclub is famous for aggressive bouncers and repeated safety violations. It is _____ in the neighborhood for trouble.
question_bank.astute: She noticed the hidden fee before signing the contract. That kind of _____ attention saved her thousands of dollars.
question_bank.versatile: This tool can cut wire, tighten screws, and open bottles. It’s remarkably _____ for something that fits in a pocket.
question_bank.derivative: Critics said the sequel copied the original plot almost scene for scene. They dismissed it as _____.
question_bank.meticulous: Every receipt was labeled, dated, and matched to an invoice in her spreadsheet. Her accountant is famously _____.
question_bank.eulogy: At the funeral, his daughter spoke about his kindness and sacrifices. She delivered a moving _____.
question_bank.dogmatic: He rejected all counterexamples and refused to reconsider his beliefs. His approach was rigidly _____.
question_bank.integrity: She refused to alter the results to please her supervisor. Her scientific _____ mattered more than approval.
question_bank.incongruous: The clown music made the memorial service feel wrong. The cheerful soundtrack was completely _____ with the solemn occasion.
question_bank.exonerate: The new DNA test proved he could not have been at the scene. The evidence helped _____ him of the charges.
question_bank.enigma: No one could explain why the system failed only on Tuesdays. The pattern remained a/an _____.
